cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of Tampa, FL and 65 miles WNW of Sarasota, FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving east toward the west-central Florida coast, then forecast to arc northeast across the peninsula and accelerate offshore of the east-central Florida coast by Tuesday, eventually recurving northeast well off the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay / Manatee County area

weather_observation.watch_coast: West coast of Florida from Anclote River southward to Englewood
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central west coast of Florida including Tampa Bay, Sarasota, and Manatee County shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–40 mph with higher gusts) possible this afternoon as the depression moves inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible (<3 ft) mainly around high tide; significant surge impacts are not anticipated.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 inches with isolated pockets up to 8 inches, producing localized flash-flood potential in low-lying areas and near-port drainage systems.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado or waterspout threat in outer rainbands; lightning and reduced visibility may disrupt cargo and vessel operations.
